result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Paul Reinhart

records.addlTxt:
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney 
DENIED. Defendant indicates he has no income yet he as expenses. Paperwork will need to be resubmitted with accurate figures for consideration.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Defendant Joshua Paul Reinhart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant will file court appointed paperwork.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits.
Prelim reset:
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant's motion to modify bail is denied.

2:15 pm - Defendant Joshua Paul Reinhart appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Bail modification motion addressed today. Defendant has not had counsel appointed yet and wishes to represent himself.  Defense argues for modification of current bail set. State objects and argues. Court denies motion and states NO PRO SE bail motions will be allowed in the future.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter from Defendant to Judge Rohrer requesting bail modification.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua Paul Reinhart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather M Faeh in court for Joshua Paul Reinhart.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of bail jumping, 4 cts. felony bail jumping and operate without owner's consent.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-03-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with J.J.C., B.S., R.W., C.B., & the premises at 1617 Marshall Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 09-26-2022
